intro: Ocotea suaveolens var. genuina, commonly known as the sweet-smelling ocotea, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Costa Rica. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves, which emit a pleasant scent when crushed. It typically grows as a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub, often found in humid, shaded forest environments. Its botanical features include simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that develop into dark, fleshy berries.
